title: Matrices with XOR property
text:
Imagine A is a NxM matrix with two basic propertiesEach element in the matrix is distinct and lies in the range of 1<=A[i][j]<=(N*M)For any two cells of the matrix, (i1,j1) and (i2,j2), if (i1^j1) > (i2^j2) then A[i1][j1] > A[i2][j2], where1 ≤ i1, i2 ≤ N1 ≤ j1, j2 ≤ M.^ is bitwise XORGiven N and M, you have to calculate the total number of matrices of size N x M which have both the properties mentioned above.InputFirst line contains T, the number of test cases. 2*T lines follow with N on the first line and M on the second, representing the number of rows and columns respectively.OutputOutput the total number of such matrices of size N x M. Since, this answer can be large, output it modulo 10^9+7Constraints1 ≤ N, M, T ≤ 1000SampleInput1
2
2Output4ExplanationThe four possible matrices are:[1 3] | [2 3] | [1 4] | [2 4][4 2] | [4 1] | [3 2] | [3 1]
